summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Denise Johannes, Director of Corporations and Trademarks for the U.S. Virgin Islands, requesting records related to the corporate entity Nautilus, Inc. The subpoena is part of a criminal investigation into suspected felonies including sex trafficking and coercion, and includes a confidentiality request and a declaration form for the custodian of records.

persons.name: Denise Johannes
persons.role: Director, Corporations and Trademarks Office of the Lt. Governor
persons.context: Recipient of the grand jury subpoena, directed to produce records related to Nautilus, Inc. and potentially testify.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signed the cover letter requesting confidentiality regarding the subpoena as part of the official criminal investigation.

persons.name: Geoff E. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena commanding the appearance and production of records.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: Denise Johannes is commanded to appear before the Grand Jury in New York to testify and give evidence regarding alleged violations of federal law.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena for records related to Nautilus, Inc. as part of a criminal investigation.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
9100 Havensight, Port of Sales, Suite 15/16, St. Thomas 00802, Virgin Islands, U.S.
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felonies, specifically alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt/conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), and 2422(b) (coercion/enticement).
The target of the subpoena is corporate records for 'Nautilus, Inc.', a company located in St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands.

The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests that the recipient voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

The subpoena demands records including certificates of incorporation, business addresses, service of process addresses, and identifying information on directors, officers, and owners of Nautilus, Inc.
